name: Hippo Cocoon Toolkit
body:
### New Hippo CMS features with old Apache Cocoon power

Loving all these shining new features by [Hippo CMS 7.x](http://www.hippocms.org) but missing the _pipeline power_ you used to have with Hippo CMS 6.x and [Apache Cocoon](http://cocoon.apache.org)?

Want to develop a modern Hippo CMS powered website with coolest technologies (HTML 5, REST, JSON, AJAX, ...)?

Hippo Cocoon Toolkit (**HCT**) comes to the rescue by empowering the [latest evolution](http://cocoon.apache.org/3.0/) (3.0) of Apache Cocoon together with Hippo CMS and repository.

### What HCT is like

With Hippo Cocoon Toolkit you can:
* build standalone Apache Cocoon webapps, taking control of the whole navigation;
* embed Hippo CMS content in JEE webapps managed by other frameworks (like as [Apache Wicket](http://wicket.apache.org/) for example);
* enhance your Hippo Site Toolkit (HST) site with some interesting HCT features like XML and PDF generation of documents stored in the Hippo repository.

### Test drive

Learn how to [get started with HCT](https://github.com/Tirasa/HippoCocoonToolkit/wiki/Getting-Started).

### Work in progress
Documentation is yet to be completed at the moment: check [this blog post](http://blog.tirasa.net/blogs/index.php/ilgrosso/cocoon-3-and-hippo-cms) in the meanwhile.

Stay tuned: we will come soon with updates, samples and success stories.

***

Hippo Cocoon Toolkit is released under [Apache License 2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html) by [Tirasa](http://www.tirasa.net).

Want to know more? Would like to contribute? Just [drop an e-mail](mailto:hct@tirasa.net).
tagline: Alternative, Apache Cocoon 3.0 based, toolkit for building web sites while relying upon Hippo CMS and Repository.
